children.text: The skirting boards are visibly not flush, which looks poorly finished.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 10.02 Joints in fixing of internal mouldings states that

‘Unless documented otherwise, the faces of architraves and skirtings are defective if they are not aligned and flush at mitres and butt joints and the misalignment can be seen from a normal viewing position’.
These skirting boards will need to be re-aligned and secured prior to sanding and painting.
